pageContext.claim: “I was explaining inside that, if you looked at a chart -- prior to our getting here -- NATO’s spending was going way, way down.”
pageContext.analysis: Before Trump even announced he was running for president, the alliance in 2014 agreed to have each member state meet a guideline of spending at least two percent of their gross domestic product on defense spending, with the goal of achieving that by 2024. The defense-spending numbers were going up before Trump won the presidency. None of of this additional spending is contributed directly to NATO.
